title: Mosaic Browser
overview: The Mosaic browser is released at NCSA, becoming the first popular graphical web browser and sparking widespread adoption of the World Wide Web.

title: Netscape Navigator
overview: Netscape launches Navigator, quickly becoming the dominant web browser of the 1990s and fueling the dot-com boom.

title: Internet Explorer
overview: Microsoft bundles Internet Explorer with Windows, triggering the first browser wars with Netscape.

title: Apple Safari
overview: Apple introduces Safari as the default browser for macOS and later iOS, built on the WebKit rendering engine.

title: Mozilla Firefox
overview: Mozilla launches Firefox, a secure and open-source alternative to Internet Explorer, rekindling competition in the browser market.

title: Google Chrome
overview: Google Chrome debuts with a minimalist UI and fast V8 JavaScript engine, later dominating the global browser market.

title: Microsoft Edge
overview: Microsoft replaces Internet Explorer with Edge, first using EdgeHTML and later switching to the Chromium engine for compatibility and speed.

title: Brave Browser
overview: Brave emerges as a privacy-focused browser with built-in ad blocking, tracker protection, and crypto integrations.
